data.title: Will Arnett, Amy Poehler and Danny McBride as Film Legends
data.meta_description: Patrick Demarchelier photographs Will Arnett as Han Solo and Amy Poehler as Bonnie Parker, and Mark Seliger photographs Danny McBride as Jack Torrance fromThe Shining for "Comedy's New Legends," in the April 2009 issue.
data.text:
(lively rock music)

Get off my Millennium Falcon!

(lively rock music)

(murmuring)

(scratch)

(lively rock music)

(scraping)

(scratch)

I should get into wardrobe! (laughing)

(laughing)

We're using 10 pounds of fake hair.

(bluesy rock music)

(whooshing)

(scraping)

(scraping)

(click)

[Man] Completely gorgeous.

I need more breast and need more sexy.

[Woman] Aw, yeah, more breast!

[Man] You have nice breasts

and I need to show the breasts.

(murmuring)

(scraping)

(scraping)

That's gorgeous, you did good.

Thank you.

I think I need more breast.

(scraping)

(thumping) (cracking)

[Man] That we can do.

[Man] Rolling!

(hard rock music)

(murmuring)

Here's Johnny!

And why Jack Nicholson?

I'll tell you, the Shining is not only,

I think, one of the scariest films ever made,

but one of my favorite films.

And I don't think I'm gonna do Jack an honor here.

(humming)

I'm a little plumper than him, I don't really have

the facial expressions he does, but I'm gonna try my best.

(energetic rock music)

How do you maintain your look?

This look right here?

Well, your look in general.

You know, (chuckling)

I've been lucky enough to be workin'

the last year, so my look has been dictated

by a lot of the films that I've been in.

A lot of those things required having facial hair,

mullets, weird box cuts, like in Pineapple Express.

So I've really been dictated by the work.

(growling)

[Man] Wendy!

Wendy!

(lively rock music)

(scrape)

(scrape)

(scrape)

(yip)

Here's Johnny!

(scraping)

Alright, and my one last question

is I'd like to know, who is your celebrity crush?

(deep exhale) That's tough.

I think it's you!

(sighing) Good answer.

I think yeah, it's you.

Alright, thank you very much.

(lively rock music)
